description:
Given a square matrix of nxn return the sum of the matrix diagonals.

Only include the sum of all the elements on the primary diagonal and all the elements on the secondary diagonal that are not part of the primary diagonal.

### Example
#### Input:
`mat = [[1,2,3], [4,5,6], [7,8,9]]`

#### Output: 25

#### Explanation:
Diagonals sum: 1 + 5 + 9 + 3 + 7 = 25   
Notice that element mat[1][1] = 5 is counted only once.

#### Constraints:  

```
n == mat.length == mat[i].length  
1 <= n <= 100  
1 <= mat[i][j] <= 100 
``` 

#### Input Format:

```
first line contains n (the size of the n*n matrix)
next n line contains n elements of the of the matrix

```

#### Output Format:
`print the sum of the diagonals`
title: Diagonal sum

code_skeletons.skeleton_define_class:
class Solution:
    def diagonalSum(self, mat: List[List[int]]) -> int:
